title: Scotland’s Leader Apologizes to Thousands of Women Executed as Witches
sub_head: Nicola Sturgeon’s move comes as Scotland considers making misogyny a crime
body:
Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon has offered a posthumous apology to thousands of women who were convicted and often executed for being witches hundreds of years ago, as her government considers whether to make misogyny a modern-day crime.
Speaking in the Scottish parliament in a debate to mark International Women’s Day, Ms. Sturgeon said she was acknowledging what she called a colossal historic injustice.
